text: now there are three things that Russia
has rather a lot of it has an olive oil
it has a lot of gas and as you can
probably see it has a lot of snow now
this was Britain I'm pretty sure that
this quantity of snow will be enough to
cause chaos on the roads but the
Russians usually manage to keep things
moving so how do they do it and after
they've cleared it what do they do with
all this snow and here they come to the
rescue
a long very long column of snowplows
there are fifteen and a half thousand
snow clearing vehicles on the roads of
Moscow tonight for this snowstorm well
this is what they call in Russian Zilla
Theodore Suki the golden hands as you
can see the snow is scooped up into the
machine it goes up a slide and into a
lorry behind but that's not the end of
the story once the snow is cleared it's
taken to another part of the city to be
disposed of and we're going along to see
how they do it
so the lorry is now dumping its load
into a bunker where it's cut into tiny
pieces by a giant Minster that's mixed
with sewage water then it's cleaned
thoroughly and eventually ends up in the
Moscow River and that is the end of the
road for the Moscow snow Steve Rosenberg
BBC news Moscow
